channel.title: Rstats on Abgründe
channel.description: Recent content in Rstats on Abgründe

item.title: Recreating Washing Post's solar eclipse plot in R
item.author: map[username:daniel.berecz host:gmail.com] (Dániel Berecz)
item.description: I will continue copycatting visualization in this post. This I seen the following visualization from a couple of difference sources: Oh, this is cool. https://t.co/eCSKI6ag3P pic.twitter.com/BoBlMjZGV7 — Teddy Amenabar (@TeddyAmen) July 10, 2017 I thought this would also be a good vis to recreate. I had a couple of different ideas on how to recreate it, but little did I know how difficult it would be. Disclaimer: I created this purely with geometrically, it doesn’t represent the true path of of an eclipse.

item.title: Test joyplot on the flights data set
item.author: map[host:gmail.com username:daniel.berecz] (Dániel Berecz)
item.description: This week I’ve seen an interting visualization tweeted: Peak time for sports and leisure #dataviz. About time for a joyplot; might do a write-up on them. #rstats code at https://t.co/Q2AgW068Wa pic.twitter.com/SVT6pkB2hB — Henrik Lindberg (@hnrklndbrg) July 8, 2017 and I thought I’d try to reproduce it on a different dataset for practice. You can find the original repo here. Setup First I load the packages with the pacman package.
